folder: Baltic Street & Bay Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
(1)
Baltic Street (vantage point, not seen), east of Bay Street. The view is in a northerly direction along the new bed of the Staten Island Railroad. On the extreme right are piers lining the shore of Upper New York Bay.

May 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Along the bank of the new railroad bed.

May 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Bay Street & William Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
465 (left) and 467 Bay Street, east side, adjoining
(to the south) William Street.

January 13, 1931

P. L. Sperr

folder: William Street & Bay Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
William Street, south side, between Bay and Van
Duzer Streets, showing the Van Duzer Homestead. When the house was demolished in 1985 it was nearly 200 years old. Abraham Van Duzer bought the house from one Ryers. For additional data, see "The New York Sun" July 26, 1895, p. 3.

Prior to 1895

Photo by Wm. T. Davis from sketch by Charles Boughton

From P.  L. Sperr Collection
